intro: Tetradium calcicola, commonly known as the limestone tetradium, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions with calcareous soils. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and distinctive yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone-rich habitats, showcasing its adaptation to nutrient-poor environments. Due to its limited distribution and specialized requirements, Tetradium calcicola is considered an endangered species in many areas.
